summary: Motivated youth advocate and educator with a background in psychology and sociology. Experienced in working with youth, including homeless populations, with mental health and behavioral support, case management, IEP development, and collaboration with families and professionals to support student development and successful transitions.
skills: Experience with low income and homeless populations

experience.title: Youth Advocate
experience.description: Work with youth ages 12-18 that are homeless (for various reasons), living in shelter with personal, social, academic, and life goals. Consult with other professionals regarding the treatment of specific clients. Counsel and prepare residents for their transition back into the community. Quickly respond to crisis situations when severe mental health and behavioral issues arose.

experience.title: Teacher
experience.description: Developed individual education plans (IEPs) designed to promote students' educational, physical, or social development. Confer with parents, administrators, testing specialists, social workers, or other professionals to develop IEPs. Confer with parents, guardians, teachers, counselors, or administrators to resolve students' behavioral or academic problems. Maintained accurate and complete student records as required by laws, district policies, or administrative regulations. Developed or implemented strategies to meet the needs of students with a variety of disabilities. Taught students personal development skills, such as goal setting, independence, or self- advocacy.

experience.title: Teacher
experience.description: Maintained accurate and complete student records as required by laws, district policies, or administrative regulations. Guided or counseled students with adjustment problems, academic problems, or special academic interests. Modified the general kindergarten or elementary education curriculum for special-needs students. Confer with parents, administrators, testing specialists, social workers, or other professionals to develop individual education plans (IEPs). Developed or implemented strategies to meet the needs of students with a variety of disabilities. Taught personal development skills, such as goal setting, independence, or self-advocacy.

experience.title: Mental Health Case Manager
experience.description: Maintain confidentiality of records relating to clients' treatment. Encourage clients to express their feelings and discuss what is happening in their lives, helping them to develop insight into themselves or their relationships. Fill out and maintain client-related paperwork, including federal- and state-mandated forms, client diagnostic records, and progress notes. Refer patients, clients, or family members to community resources or to specialists as necessary.

experience.title: Teacher
experience.description: Confer with parents, administrators, testing specialists, social workers, or other professionals to develop individual education plans (IEPs). Develop individual educational plans (IEPs) designed to promote students' educational, physical, or social development. Encouraged students to persevere with challenging tasks. Differentiated instruction according to student ability and skill level. Encouraged parents to take an active role in their child's education.
